description: The execution trace of calling an app or a logic sig, containing the inner app call trace in a recursive way.

approval-program-hash.description: SHA512_256 hash digest of the approval program executed in transaction.

approval-program-trace.description: Program trace that contains a trace of opcode effects in an approval program.

items.description: The set of trace information and effect from evaluating a single opcode.

pc.description: The program counter of the current opcode being evaluated.

items.description: A write operation into a scratch slot.

type.description: value type. Value `1` refers to **bytes**, value `2` refers to **uint64**

spawned-inners.description: The indexes of the traces for inner transactions spawned by this opcode, if any.

stack-additions.description: The values added by this opcode to the stack.

type.description: value type. Value `1` refers to **bytes**, value `2` refers to **uint64**

stack-pop-count.description: The number of deleted stack values by this opcode.

state-changes.description: The operations against the current application's states.

items.description: An operation against an application's global/local/box state.

account.description: For local state changes, the address of the account associated with the local state.

app-state-type.description: Type of application state. Value `g` is **global state**, `l` is **local state**, `b` is **boxes**.

key.description: The key (name) of the global/local/box state.

type.description: value type. Value `1` refers to **bytes**, value `2` refers to **uint64**

clear-state-program-hash.description: SHA512_256 hash digest of the clear state program executed in transaction.

clear-state-program-trace.description: Program trace that contains a trace of opcode effects in a clear state program.

items.description: The set of trace information and effect from evaluating a single opcode.

pc.description: The program counter of the current opcode being evaluated.

items.description: A write operation into a scratch slot.

type.description: value type. Value `1` refers to **bytes**, value `2` refers to **uint64**

spawned-inners.description: The indexes of the traces for inner transactions spawned by this opcode, if any.

stack-additions.description: The values added by this opcode to the stack.

type.description: value type. Value `1` refers to **bytes**, value `2` refers to **uint64**

stack-pop-count.description: The number of deleted stack values by this opcode.

state-changes.description: The operations against the current application's states.

items.description: An operation against an application's global/local/box state.

account.description: For local state changes, the address of the account associated with the local state.

app-state-type.description: Type of application state. Value `g` is **global state**, `l` is **local state**, `b` is **boxes**.

key.description: The key (name) of the global/local/box state.

type.description: value type. Value `1` refers to **bytes**, value `2` refers to **uint64**

clear-state-rollback.description: If true, indicates that the clear state program failed and any persistent state changes it produced should be reverted once the program exits.

clear-state-rollback-error.description: The error message explaining why the clear state program failed. This field will only be populated if clear-state-rollback is true and the failure was due to an execution error.

inner-trace.description: An array of SimulationTransactionExecTrace representing the execution trace of any inner transactions executed.

logic-sig-hash.description: SHA512_256 hash digest of the logic sig executed in transaction.

logic-sig-trace.description: Program trace that contains a trace of opcode effects in a logic sig.

items.description: The set of trace information and effect from evaluating a single opcode.

pc.description: The program counter of the current opcode being evaluated.

items.description: A write operation into a scratch slot.

type.description: value type. Value `1` refers to **bytes**, value `2` refers to **uint64**

type.description: value type. Value `1` refers to **bytes**, value `2` refers to **uint64**
